definition: nature/character/property/quality/attribute/sexuality/sex/gender/suffix forming adjective from verb/suffix forming noun from adjective, corresponding to -ness or -ity/essence/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: In the case of non-Euclidean geometry he published no definitive work.
sentences.chinese: 至於非歐幾里德幾何，他沒有發表過權威性的著作。

sentences.english: The report is authoritative, but this is not a comprehensive text.
sentences.chinese: 這份報告具有權威性，但文字並沒有包羅萬象。

sentences.english: I mention all this by way of defining my bona fides for the following commentary.
sentences.chinese: 說到這些，只是爲了說明我作出下述評論的權威性。

sentences.english: Increase their level of responsibility and authority.
sentences.chinese: 增加他們的責任感和權威性。

sentences.english: The ingenious man received the prestigeous award for the first time.
sentences.chinese: 那位有獨創性的人首次接受這個具權威性的獎。

sentences.english: That anti-hierarchy and authority of the discourse.
sentences.chinese: 即反等級制度和權威性話語。

sentences.english: Compiling and implementing plans and safeguarding their authority and integrity;
sentences.chinese: 自主編制和實施規劃，維護規劃的權威性和嚴肅性。

sentences.english: Babbitt was without a canon which would enable him to speak with authority.
sentences.chinese: 巴比特無章可循，不能作權威性的發言了。

sentences.english: Some users can have high authority but very few (relative) inbound links.
sentences.chinese: 有的用戶有很高的權威性，但是沒有多少外部鏈接。

sentences.english: He also sounded weaker, his voice raspier and less authoritative than usual. It.
sentences.chinese: 他的聲音聽上去很微小，而且不象往常那樣有權威性。

sentences.english: The eldest, Bushra, is said to be influential and authoritative.
sentences.chinese: 中的長女，布沙拉，被認爲是影響力和權威性。

sentences.english: Its authoritativeness had never been higher.
sentences.chinese: 它的權威性從沒有比那時更高過。

sentences.english: In the tourist zone, should emphasize the authoritativeness of planning.
sentences.chinese: 在旅遊區，應強調規劃的權威性。

sentences.english: There is a trend for knocking public-school headmasters and headmistresses off their perch es.
sentences.chinese: 現在有一種推翻公立學校校長權威性的趨勢。
很明顯，這首詩有其權威性。
他們否認他的學說的權威性。

definition: to run neck and neck/to keep pace with/to keep abreast of/on a par with one another
